oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EXAMINATION OF CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION STRATEGIES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kaiser, Ralf
Knaack, Heiko
Miani, Marco
Niemeyer, Hanz Dieter
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: climate change
coastal protection
adaptation
storm surges
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Climate change adaptation strategies for coastal protection are examined with the help of mathematical models in the Ems/Dollart Estuary in consideration of different climate scenarios. The Ems Dollart Estuary is located at the Dutch German border in the southern North Sea, a coastal area which has suffered from enormous land losses due to medieval storm surges. Since then the medieval retreat was partly reduced by successive land reclamation following the development of salt marshes.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 32 (2010): Proceedings of 32nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Shanghai, China, 2010.; management.2
